alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 12:58PM MST until March 06 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW PRODUCING HAZARDOUS TRAVEL IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTH AND EAST OF DENVER... .Snow will continue to be heavier south and southeast of Denver this afternoon, then diminish and move further southeast this evening. As of early afternoon, roads in these areas were slushy and Interstate 70 was closed east of Limon. Conditions will gradually improve from west to east in the late afternoon and evening. In the higher mountains, light to moderate snowfall will continue this afternoon and will have some impact on Interstate 70 travel. Light snow will continue in the mountains overnight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Castle Rock, Limon, and Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely be slushy or icy. Plan on slippery road conditions and slow travel. As of early afternoon, Interstate 70 was closed east of Limon.
info.instruction: Consider delaying travel until conditions improve this evening. If you do travel, slow down, use extra caution, and plan on slow and difficult driving. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
